content.raw: not, is not being used, deleted.
is this needed? There is a few more in other classes
content.html: is this needed? There is a few more in other classes

content.raw: you'll need to port the [picker.material](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/8a59b5f0f0b9bda21ee905098b47900da492ba9c/media/materials/scripts/picker.material?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default) file from gazebo, and also its [vertex](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/8a59b5f0f0b9bda21ee905098b47900da492ba9c/media/materials/programs/plain_color_vs.glsl?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default) and [fragment](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/8a59b5f0f0b9bda21ee905098b47900da492ba9c/media/materials/programs/plain_color_fs.glsl?fileviewer=file-view-default) shaders. You can put them in `src/ogre/media` directory
content.html: you'll need to port the picker.material file from gazebo, and also its vertex and fragment shaders. You can put them in src/ogre/media directory

content.raw: can you add `Ogre` prefix to class names and these files?
content.html: can you add Ogre prefix to class names and these files?

content.raw:
~~~ign-rendering is lacking behind in documentation. Could you add doxygen comments to the new classes, functions, and variables you added, thanks.~~~

Actually you don't need to add this function. In your mouse picking example, you should be able to get a pointer to the camera using `rayCamera->Scene()`
content.html:
~ign-rendering is lacking behind in documentation. Could you add doxygen comments to the new classes, functions, and variables you added, thanks.~

Actually you don't need to add this function. In your mouse picking example, you should be able to get a pointer to the camera using rayCamera->Scene()

content.raw: ign-rendering is lacking behind in documentation. Could you add doxygen comments to the new classes, functions, and variables you added, thanks.
content.html: ign-rendering is lacking behind in documentation. Could you add doxygen comments to the new classes, functions, and variables you added, thanks.

content.raw:
Looks like `Scene's VisualAt` function is done but the selection buffer is not currently used? Could you also integrate selection buffer?  thanks

It's mainly used by the [UserCamera](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/8a59b5f0f0b9bda21ee905098b47900da492ba9c/gazebo/rendering/UserCamera.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default) class in gazebo. We could probably just integrate it in ignition rendering's `OgreCamera` class.

Selection buffer is more efficient than ray queries and more suitable for heavy use by the gui.
content.html:
Looks like Scene's VisualAt function is done but the selection buffer is not currently used? Could you also integrate selection buffer? thanks

It's mainly used by the UserCamera class in gazebo. We could probably just integrate it in ignition rendering's OgreCamera class.

Selection buffer is more efficient than ray queries and more suitable for heavy use by the gui.

content.raw: for the derived classes, you can just put `// Documentation inherited`
content.html: for the derived classes, you can just put // Documentation inherited

content.raw: I think this flag is not really used even in gazebo, we can remove this for now
content.html: I think this flag is not really used even in gazebo, we can remove this for now

content.raw: can you update all the copyright headers to year 2018?
content.html: can you update all the copyright headers to year 2018?

update.description:
This PR adds a simple demo. When you click in an object it returns the shape name in the terminal. Only works with ogre for now.

Addresses issue #19:
update.title: Mouse picking demo
